elements.label: Workspace
elements.helpText: Your workspace should be the same as it was for the pollination biophysical component.  It contains datasets used by this model.

elements.label: Guilds table
elements.helpText: The guilds table should be either a CSV or DBF and should contain information about the pollinators being considered by this model. You must use the same guilds table as was used in the biophysical pollination model.

elements.label: Half-saturation constant
elements.helpText: This should be a number between 0 and 1.  It represents the abundance of pollinators required to reack 50% of pollinator-dependent yield.

elements.label: Proportion of total yield due to wild pollinators
elements.helpText: This should be a number between 0 and 1.  It represents the proportion of all crop yield attributed to wild pollinators on this landscape.

elements.label: Perform valuation on future scenario
elements.helpText: Check this box if you would like valuation to be performed on the future scenario. NOTE: checking this box requires that you have already run the biophysical pollination model on both a current and future scenario using this workspace.

elements.label: Results suffix
elements.helpText: IMPORTANT: If you used a results suffix for your corresponding run of the pollination biophysical model, you must enter the same suffix here. Failure to do so will result in errors.
